body: An additional note is that I've previously run 0.10.x versions just fine on this network. At first I upgraded and I started seeing these panics. After that I opted to remove all config + db:s and start over on 0.11.1 from scratch connecting nodes all over again. Still seeing these panics though.

```
goroutine 1 [semacquire, 1496 minutes]:
sync.(*WaitGroup).Wait(0xc20a2d6040)
    /usr/local/go/src/sync/waitgroup.go:132 +0x169
github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/upnp.Discover(0xb2d05e00, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
    /go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/upnp/upnp.go:144 +0x7d0
main.setupUPnP()
    /go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/cmd/syncthing/main.go:776 +0x2b4
main.syncthingMain()
    /go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/cmd/syncthing/main.go:582 +0x23a6
main.main()
    /go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/cmd/syncthing/main.go:372 +0x218b
```

UPnP discovery seems to have hung, so we don't complete startup.

```
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal 0xb code=0x1 addr=0x48 pc=0x5a75d7]

goroutine 111 [running]:
github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/model.func·008()
    /go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/model/model.go:1144 +0x237
created by github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/model.(*Model).ScanFolders
    /go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/model/model.go:1147 +0x6a9
```

Panic because we end up in the scanning code even though we have not started yet... A separate bug?
Can you start this as `STTRACE=upnp syncthing` once and post the output? Just the first minute or so is fine.

Actually never mind, no need. This is the root cause:

```
goroutine 50 [syscall, 1496 minutes]:
syscall.Syscall6(0x2d, 0x17, 0xc209f62000, 0x1000, 0x0, 0xc209f5f548, 0xc209f5f544, 0x1000, 0x887f01, 0xc209f62000)
    /usr/local/go/src/syscall/asm_linux_amd64.s:46 +0x5
syscall.recvfrom(0x17, 0xc209f62000, 0x1000, 0x1000, 0x0, 0xc209f5f548, 0xc209f5f544, 0x11, 0x0, 0x0)
    /usr/local/go/src/syscall/zsyscall_linux_amd64.go:1906 +0x9b
syscall.Recvfrom(0x17, 0xc209f62000, 0x1000, 0x1000, 0x0, 0x1000, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
    /usr/local/go/src/syscall/syscall_unix.go:220 +0xbf
syscall.NetlinkRIB(0x16, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
    /usr/local/go/src/syscall/netlink_linux.go:71 +0x3dd
net.interfaceAddrTable(0xc209f5ff90, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
    /usr/local/go/src/net/interface_linux.go:121 +0x77
net.(*Interface).Addrs(0xc209f5ff90, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
    /usr/local/go/src/net/interface.go:67 +0x94
net.setIPv4MreqToInterface(0xc209f5fa88, 0xc209f5ff90, 0x0, 0x0)
    /usr/local/go/src/net/sockopt_posix.go:78 +0x75
net.joinIPv4Group(0xc209874230, 0xc209f5ff90, 0xc20b4f7530, 0x4, 0x4, 0x0, 0x0)
    /usr/local/go/src/net/sockoptip_posix.go:16 +0xdb
net.listenIPv4MulticastUDP(0xc208610028, 0xc209f5ff90, 0xc20b4f7530, 0x4, 0x4, 0x0, 0x0)
    /usr/local/go/src/net/udpsock_posix.go:249 +0x104
net.ListenMulticastUDP(0xa4c990, 0x4, 0xc209f5ff90, 0xc20a4a4630, 0x90, 0x0, 0x0)
    /usr/local/go/src/net/udpsock_posix.go:227 +0x473
github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/upnp.discover(0xc209f5ff90, 0xb1bad0, 0x33, 0xb2d05e00, 0xc20a2c7980)
    /go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/upnp/upnp.go:177 +0x52d
github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/upnp.func·002(0x7, 0x5dc, 0xc20b36ce70, 0xb, 0xc20a1fc878, 0x6, 0x2188, 0x3, 0xb1bad0, 0x33)
    /go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/upnp/upnp.go:138 +0x63
created by github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/upnp.Discover
    /go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/upnp/upnp.go:140 +0x761
```

https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/blob/master/internal/upnp/upnp.go#L177 seems to block forever. That's bad.
Needs a bug in golang/go I guess?
Possibly. We end up [here](http://golang.org/src/syscall/netlink_linux.go#L71), where the recv seems to block forever. I wonder if they should have some timeout handling there.

@johnae Actually, can you run that `STTRACE=upnp syncthing` anyway? I'm curious about what interface we hang on, and if there's something curious there. Any VPNs or virtualization running on this box?
We should probably filter for interfaces that are UP and claim to support multicast anyhow, like we do in the discovery beacon.

Yes. In a docker container. Both machines are but the one affected is also
running openvpn so theres a tun0 iface there.
tis 28 apr 2015 kl. 10:22 skrev Jakob Borg notifications@github.com:

> We should probably filter for interfaces that are UP and claim to support
> multicast anyhow, like we do in the discovery beacon.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/1721#issuecomment-96970757
> .

@johnae Can you check if this build works better/differently?

http://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing-branch/11/artifact/
@calmh Sorry for the delay. Yes, this build seems to work better. Haven't been able to reproduce.

issue.title: Stuck on Starting UPnP Discovery

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body: I have two devices, the first one is able to get up and running fine. The second one gets stuck on Starting UPnP Discovery. Can anyone point me in the right direction?
